The headers have to be :headers, you are: The headers have to be :headers, you are missing at least one!
You need to have at least the columns :h: You need to have at least the columns :headers
You have to upload a valid file!: You have to upload a valid file!

You don't appear to have added any :type: You don't appear to have added any :types yet!

A new verification link has been sent to: A new verification link has been sent to your email address.
You do not have permission to delete thi: You do not have permission to delete this marker.
You first have to add or select your Del: You first have to add or select your Delivery Service Provider.
You do not have permission to view this: You do not have permission to view this vehicle.
Your payment was not successful, please: Your payment was not successful, please try again.
Your subscription has been cancelled suc: Your subscription has been cancelled successfully.
Your subscription has been resumed succe: Your subscription has been resumed successfully.
You are all setup now, why don't you try: You are all setup now, why don't you try adding your first route?
These credentials do not match our recor: These credentials do not match our records.
Too many login attempts. Please try agai: Too many login attempts. Please try again in :seconds seconds.
Something went wrong. Please refresh the: Something went wrong. Please refresh the page.
You can not add a route before your star: You can not add a route before your start date with the DSP.
This is a secure area of the application: This is a secure area of the application. Please confirm your password before continuing.
No problem. Just let us know your email: No problem. Just let us know your email address and we will email you a password reset link that will allow you to choose a new one.
name: name
Thanks for signing up! Before getting st: Thanks for signing up! Before getting started, could you verify your email address by clicking on the link we just emailed to you? If you didn't receive the email, we will gladly send you another.
A new verification link has been sent to: A new verification link has been sent to the email address you provided during registration.
Search here for the name of the Delivery: Search here for the name of the Delivery Service Provider you work for. It's important you select the correct one, as they differ in their pay rates. The one you select, if already added, will most likely already have rates set to date.
The date that you started working for th: The date that you started working for this DSP. As you can add many, you will only be able to change anything on the latest one you have selected.
The name of your Delivery Service Provid: The name of your Delivery Service Provider. Please be accurate with this as anyone else searching for your DSP will want to find it easily. Also if there is any profanity found the DSP will be removed and you will loose any data added.
Amazons identifier for your Delivery Ser: Amazons identifier for your Delivery Service Provider, you can ask your OSM for this if you don't know it. It's another way for other drivers to find the correct DSP.
How many weeks after you have worked bef: How many weeks after you have worked before you are paid, this is usually 2 week, but your DSP may be different.
The day of the week that your DSP pays i: The day of the week that your DSP pays it's drivers. This can be different for different DSPs.
This is used to categorize the expense f: This is used to categorize the expense for tax purposes.
What the expense was, only helpful for y: What the expense was, only helpful for your records.
The cost of the expense. Will help with: The cost of the expense. Will help with expense calculation for taxes.
Add a photo of your receipt. This will b: Add a photo of your receipt. This will be kept available to you for tax purposes.
If :type is missing, it will just be set: If :type is missing, it will just be set as :work.
This Privacy Policy describes Our polici: This Privacy Policy describes Our policies and procedures on the collection, use and disclosure of Your information when You use the Service and tells You about Your privacy rights and how the law protects You.

refers to data collected automatically,: refers to data collected automatically, either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

Collecting and Using Your Personal Data: Collecting and Using Your Personal Data
While using Our Service, We may ask You: While using Our Service, We may ask You to provide Us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify You. Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:
Usage Data is collected automatically wh: Usage Data is collected automatically when using the Service.
Usage Data may include information such: Usage Data may include information such as Your Device's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that You visit, the time and date of Your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.
When You access the Service by or throug: When You access the Service by or through a mobile device, We may collect certain information automatically, including, but not limited to, the type of mobile device You use, Your mobile device unique ID, the IP address of Your mobile device, Your mobile operating system, the type of mobile Internet browser You use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.
We may also collect information that You: We may also collect information that Your browser sends whenever You visit our Service or when You access the Service by or through a mobile device.
We use Cookies and similar tracking tech: We use Cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on Our Service and store certain information. Tracking technologies used are beacons, tags, and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze Our Service. The technologies We use may include:
A cookie is a small file placed on Your: A cookie is a small file placed on Your Device. You can instruct Your browser to refuse all Cookies or to indicate when a Cookie is being sent. However, if You do not accept Cookies, You may not be able to use some parts of our Service. Unless you have adjusted Your browser setting so that it will refuse Cookies, our Service may use Cookies.
Certain sections of our Service and our: Certain sections of our Service and our emails may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs, pixel tags, and single-pixel gifs) that permit the Company, for example, to count users who have visited those pages or opened an email and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of a certain section and verifying system and server integrity).
Cookies can be \"Persistent\" or \"Sessi: Cookies can be "Persistent" or "Session" Cookies. Persistent Cookies remain on Your personal computer or mobile device when You go offline, while Session Cookies are deleted as soon as You close Your web browser. Learn more about cookies on the
We use both Session and Persistent Cooki: We use both Session and Persistent Cookies for the purposes set out below:
Purpose: These Cookies are essential to: Purpose: These Cookies are essential to provide You with services available through the Website and to enable You to use some of its features. They help to authenticate users and prevent fraudulent use of user accounts. Without these Cookies, the services that You have asked for cannot be provided, and We only use these Cookies to provide You with those services.
Purpose: These Cookies identify if users: Purpose: These Cookies identify if users have accepted the use of cookies on the Website.
Purpose: These Cookies allow us to remem: Purpose: These Cookies allow us to remember choices You make when You use the Website, such as remembering your login details or language preference. The purpose of these Cookies is to provide You with a more personal experience and to avoid You having to re-enter your preferences every time You use the Website.
For more information about the cookies w: For more information about the cookies we use and your choices regarding cookies, please visit our Cookies Policy or the Cookies section of our Privacy Policy.

This is where the rates are set per DSP: This is where the rates are set per DSP and Depot, as the rates are different for each of these things you have to make sure you select the correct ones.
These can be created by anyone that has: These can be created by anyone that has selected the same DSP as yourself. There is a log of who created, updated or deleted any shared record.
The type of rate you want to add. They a: The type of rate you want to add. They are all explained on the selection.
The depot the rate is being added for.

The rate of the type you are adding.
creator: creator
For this to work you have to completely: For this to work you have to completely fill your tank on each refuel, have the first reading from a full tank and complete this on each refuel.
Honestly, it is worth it to see the extr: Honestly, it is worth it to see the extra money you earn on fuel each day though.
The date of the refuel. This will be use: The date of the refuel. This will be used to both sort the refuels and to find the most accurate cost per mile on your routes.
The reading from your odometer when you: The reading from your odometer when you fill the tank. You have to completely fill the tank to get an accurate reading of how many miles since the last refill it cost to fill up.
The amount the refuel cost. This has hel: The amount the refuel cost. This has help to show the exact cost per mile since the last refuel.
Have you skipped any refuels to this one: Have you skipped any refuels to this one OR is this the first?
Make sure the data is only for the curre: Make sure the data is only for the currently selected vehicle.
This is used to determine the day rate f: This is used to determine the day rate for the route.
The depot you're working out of for this: The depot you're working out of for this route. Also used to determine the day rate for the route. If the depot you're working out of is not present, click the `Not Found` button to add it yourself.
The date you worked the route.
The time you were there to load your veh: The time you were there to load your vehicle.
Set this as the time you do or should ar: Set this as the time you do or should arrive back at the depot. This makes it more accurate for hourly rates.
The odometer reading when you arrive at: The odometer reading when you arrive at the depot. The `+` section will add that figure to the mileage. Useful if you fill in before getting to the destination.
Amount to add to entered mileage.
The odometer reading for the end of your: The odometer reading for the end of your route, when you have returned to the depot. If you don't go back, set it to what it would have been back at the depot. This helps for accurate fuel costs and earnings.
Once you receive your invoice enter the: Once you receive your invoice enter the mileage amazon have paid you for the route. This shows an accurate total for earnings when coupled with the fuel rate for the week.
Add any bonuses or subtractions to this: Add any bonuses or subtractions to this input, it will calculate correctly for the total for the route.
You you claim VAT from amazon mark this: You you claim VAT from amazon mark this as Yes! It will calculate the extra pay for you.
Will give you a better result for your s: Will give you a better result for your stops per hour. This is subtracted from the total time of your route before dividing by stops.
This is totally optional, but it will sh: This is totally optional, but it will show you your stops/locations per hour and give you an overall average.
Used to determine stops per hour!: Used to determine stops per hour!
You may want to remind yourself of somet: You may want to remind yourself of something about this route. You can write that here.
By selecting the depot you work out of b: By selecting the depot you work out of below, if you are importing data that was NOT exported from this site, it will add these routes to that depot.
Rooftop accurate address finder with nav: Rooftop accurate address finder with navigation links.
Shared geolocational information display: Shared geolocational information displayed on map.
Accurately track and view your daily and: Accurately track and view your daily and weekly earnings.
All your data displayed in a readable fo: All your data displayed in a readable format.
Store all your refuels and calculate the: Store all your refuels and calculate the costs.
Perform accurate calculations for predic: Perform accurate calculations for predicted income.
Store and calculate all of your expenses: Store and calculate all of your expenses.
Get an overview of everything calculated: Get an overview of everything calculated for your taxes.
You pay nothing for the first 7 days. Th: You pay nothing for the first 7 days. Then only...

Once your account is deleted, all of its: Once your account is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted. Before deleting your account, please download any data or information that you wish to retain.
We separate each vehicle for refuels, th: We separate each vehicle for refuels, this makes it easier to see the difference in your fuel costs, like if one vehicle ran cheaper than another.
The depot that you work out of, this can: The depot that you work out of, this can be changed per route, but it is better to have a default so you don't need to change it each time you add a new route.
The location of your depot, for instance: The location of your depot, for instance this could be Chester, Liverpool, Warrington etc...
Amazons identifier for your depot, you c: Amazons identifier for your depot, you can ask your OSM for this if you don't know it. It's another way for other drivers to find the correct depot.
Here you should add your day rate if you: Here you should add your day rate if you know it. First select the type of route you do, then set the date that rate started at, then the actual rate.
With these done, when you add your first: With these done, when you add your first route, the amount you are being paid will be calculated.
The date that the rate is started from,: The date that the rate is started from, just set your first day if you do not know that actual date it started.
